channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [HIVE-1044] Data output order is incorrect for map join
item.description:
For query:
select /* + mapjoin(a, c) * / * from T1 a join T12 b join T1 c on a.key = b.key and b.key = c.key;

The output data order is b.* a.* c.*

It should be a.* b.* c.*
item.summary: Data output order is incorrect for map join

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: this is also true for stream table.
actually this join query is wrong. close this issue.

item.title: [HIVE-1045] (bigint % int) should return bigint instead of double
item.description:
This expression should return bigint instead of double.

CREATE TABLE test (a BIGINT);
EXPLAIN SELECT a % 3 FROM test;

There must be something wrong in FunctionRegistry.getMethodInternal
item.summary: (bigint % int) should return bigint instead of double

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Posting a little early - in the process of running full test suite
Looks good. I will test and commit if tests pass.

There are 3 failures (in trunk):

.ptest_3/test.17.2.1.log: [junit] junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Semantic Analysis has unexpected output with error code = 1
–
Fixed test case. I'm re-running the test suite but if your run finishes or has an error before mine does, please let me know.

Still fails. It seems that running a single test produced different result from running multiple tests for TestParse.

Can you verify that and (if necessary) open another JIRA?

item.title: [HIVE-1046] Pass build.dir.hive and other properties to subant
item.description:
Currently we are not passing properties like "build.dir.hive" etc to subant.
We should do that, otherwise setting "build.dir.hive" is not useful.
item.summary: Pass build.dir.hive and other properties to subant

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Modified all places to use user-specified directory.

This will do the job:

ant test -Dbuild.dir.hive=abc

Note that the derby directory is still in build. There is no easy way to change that because derby does not do variable substitution in conf.
+1 changes looks good.

+1

will commit if the tests pass
TestMTQueries is failing - can you take a look ?

The reason why this error is getting triggered is because previously diff would ignore lines that contained /tmp/. Now that we are using a user specified directory, that line doesn't get ignored anymore.

Normally, lines that begin with 'file:/' get ignored anyway, but in groupby1.q, we do:

set fs.default.name=invalidscheme:///;

EXPLAIN
FROM src INSERT OVERWRITE TABLE dest_g1 SELECT src.key, sum(substr(src.value,5)) GROUP BY src.key;

The issue with this test is that the log file will contain invalidscheme:/<user's directory> and he user's directory will always trip up the test.

Thanks for the analysis Paul!
I will modify the diff command to ignore the lines starting with "invalidscheme".

It turns out that I have to pass the parameters down to the jvm that is spawned from MapRedTask.

Note that the variables in hive-site.xml are expanded by referencing to Java System Properties (the properties passed by "-D" to jvm, or by "sysproperty" directive in build-comon.xml junit test).
Committed. Thanks Zheng
Committed in 0.5 also

item.title: [HIVE-1047] Merge tasks in GenMRUnion1
item.description:
In the following query:

from (select * from src union all select * from src) s
insert overwrite table src_multi1 select * where key < 10
insert overwrite table src_multi2 select * where key > 10 and key < 20;

There are two topOps (TableScaneOperator) for the same MapRed task. In genTableScan1, each TableScanOperator will create a new task as currTask. The genMRUnion1 should merge two tasks into one. Currently GenMRUnion1 does not merge currTask, this will cause down stream operators like genFileSink1 to do some hacks to effectively merge the two tasks. A cleaner way is to merge the tasks in GenMRUnion1 as done by join operators etc.
item.summary: Merge tasks in GenMRUnion1

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Uploading HIVE-1047.patch, which merges the currTask in GenMRUnion1 rather than GenMRFileSink1.

Looks good - just wanted to make sure that there is a test case which does

union followed by a reduce sink (maybe a group by or something like that).
actually union11.q does the above - let me run the tests
Committed. Thanks Ning

item.title: [HIVE-1048] TestParse produces different results when running a single test vs multiple tests
item.description:
This issue can be reproduced by running:

ant test -Dtestcase=TestParse -Dqfile=input8.q

Although the individual test fails, running all the tests with 'ant test' has no problems.
item.summary: TestParse produces different results when running a single test vs multiple tests

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Output diff

    [junit] 150c150
    [junit] <                    <string>CNTR_NAME_FS_2_NUM_INPUT_ROWS</string>
    [junit] ---
    [junit] >                    <string>CNTR_NAME_FS_312_NUM_INPUT_ROWS</string>
    [junit] 153c153
    [junit] <                    <string>CNTR_NAME_FS_2_NUM_OUTPUT_ROWS</string>
    [junit] ---
    [junit] >                    <string>CNTR_NAME_FS_312_NUM_OUTPUT_ROWS</string>

    [junit] 159c159
    [junit] <                    <string>CNTR_NAME_FS_2_FATAL_ERROR</string>
    [junit] ---
    [junit] >                    <string>CNTR_NAME_FS_312_FATAL_ERROR</string>
    [junit] 164c164
    [junit] <                  <string>FS_2</string>
    [junit] ---
    [junit] >                  <string>FS_312</string>
    [junit] 374c374
    [junit] <                <string>CNTR_NAME_SEL_1_NUM_INPUT_ROWS</string>
    [junit] ---
    [junit] >                <string>CNTR_NAME_SEL_311_NUM_INPUT_ROWS</string>
    [junit] 377c377
    [junit] <                <string>CNTR_NAME_SEL_1_NUM_OUTPUT_ROWS</string>
    [junit] ---
    [junit] >                <string>CNTR_NAME_SEL_311_NUM_OUTPUT_ROWS</string>
    [junit] 380c380
    [junit] <                <string>CNTR_NAME_SEL_1_TIME_TAKEN</string>
    [junit] ---
    [junit] >                <string>CNTR_NAME_SEL_311_TIME_TAKEN</string>
    [junit] 383c383
    [junit] <                <string>CNTR_NAME_SEL_1_FATAL_ERROR</string>
    [junit] ---
    [junit] >                <string>CNTR_NAME_SEL_311_FATAL_ERROR</string>
    [junit] 388c388
    [junit] <              <string>SEL_1</string>
    [junit] ---
    [junit] >              <string>SEL_311</string>
    [junit] 458c458
    [junit] <            <string>CNTR_NAME_TS_0_NUM_INPUT_ROWS</string>
    [junit] ---
    [junit] >            <string>CNTR_NAME_TS_310_NUM_INPUT_ROWS</string>
    [junit] 461c461
    [junit] <            <string>CNTR_NAME_TS_0_NUM_OUTPUT_ROWS</string>
    [junit] ---
    [junit] >            <string>CNTR_NAME_TS_310_NUM_OUTPUT_ROWS</string>
    [junit] 464c464
    [junit] <            <string>CNTR_NAME_TS_0_TIME_TAKEN</string>
    [junit] ---
    [junit] >            <string>CNTR_NAME_TS_310_TIME_TAKEN</string>
    [junit] 467c467
    [junit] <            <string>CNTR_NAME_TS_0_FATAL_ERROR</string>
    [junit] ---
    [junit] >            <string>CNTR_NAME_TS_310_FATAL_ERROR</string>
    [junit] 479c479
    [junit] <          <string>TS_0</string>
    [junit] ---
    [junit] >          <string>TS_310</string>

This is expected - since it is a counter.

We can either invoke a initialize function at the beginning of each unit test which will make the counter back to 0, or
ignore this as we do in TestCliDriver output.

I would prefer the former approach - a setup() method exists which probably does nothing today
QTestUtil.init() is called before every unit test which this initialization can be done.
To clarify a bit, the number in CNTR_NAME_TS_#_FATAL_ERROR etc is the Operator ID. So you need to reset the Operator ID counter from the init() function if possible.

• Added Operator.resetId() to reset seqId
  • Added init to CommandProcessor interface
  • Added Driver.init() to reset operator Id's in QTestUtil
• Fixed conflicts

+1

looks good - will commit in trunk and 0.5 if tests pass
Committed in 0.5 and trunk. Thanks Paul

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
• Fixed eclipse-files target.
  • Fixed javadoc target by setting maxheapsize to 1Gb
  • Added descriptions for a bunch of targets:
hd6 % ant -p
Buildfile: build.xml

Main targets:

 binary               Make tarball without source and documentation
 changes-to-html      Convert CHANGES.txt into an html file
 clean                Clean build artifacts
 clean-eclipse-files  Delete files for Eclipse
 clean-test           Clean test results
 compile-cpp          Build CPP artifacts
 compile-cpp-clean    Clean CPP artifacts
 eclipse-files        Generate files for Eclipse
 gen-testdata         Generate test data
 jar                  Build JAR artifacts
 javadoc              Generate Javadoc
 package              Deploy JAR artifacts
 package-cpp          Deploy CPP artifacts
 tar                  Make release tarball
 test                 Run tests
 testreport           Generate JUnit HTML test report
Default target: jar
+1. looks good.
Committed. Thanks Carl!

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: HIVE-1049. Fix ant targets "eclipse-files" and "javadoc". (Carl Steinbach via zshao)

item.title: [HIVE-1050] Reduce the memory foot-print of HiveInputSplit
item.description:
HiveInputSplit now inherits from FileSplit just because we want MapTask to forward the file name of the mapper:
This makes HiveInputSplit big. See MAPREDUCE-1374

  private void updateJobWithSplit(final JobConf job, InputSplit inputSplit) {
    if (inputSplit instanceof FileSplit) {
      FileSplit fileSplit = (FileSplit) inputSplit;
      job.set("map.input.file", fileSplit.getPath().toString());
      job.setLong("map.input.start", fileSplit.getStart());
      job.setLong("map.input.length", fileSplit.getLength());
      LOG.info("split: " + job.get("map.input.file")+", range: "
               + job.getLong("map.input.start", 0) + "-"
               + job.getLong("map.input.length", 0));
    }
  }

Once we move to the new MapReduce framework, we should be able to make smaller HiveInputFormat which will reduce the amount of memory needed on JobClient.
item.summary: Reduce the memory foot-print of HiveInputSplit

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-1051] Test using fs.default.name in groupby1.q may be ineffective
item.description:
A test query in groupby1.q sets fs.default.name to invalidscheme:/// and then runs an explain. The resulting output log contains a line of the form invalidschme:/<user path containing /tmp/>. Because of /tmp/, the line will get ignored.

If the objective of the test is to verify that we see invalidscheme:/ in the explain, then the test is ineffective because the current diff setup will ignore the line. Since there isn't a good way to test this, perhaps we should remove the test for now.

If the objective of the test is to verify that fs.default.name can be set to something invalid and not throw an error during an explain, then we should change fs.default.name to invalidschemefile:/// to so that the line gets ignored even if the directory changes (HIVE-1046)
item.summary: Test using fs.default.name in groupby1.q may be ineffective

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-1052] Hive jdbc client - throws exception when query was too long
item.description:
I tried this query below

select columns from table where columnS='AAA' or columnS='BBB' or columnS='CCC' or ... etc

it took a long time and throw exception after that
... for hive jdbc

FAILED: Unknown exception: org.apache.hadoop.security.AccessControlException: 
org.apache.hadoop.security.AccessControlException: Permission denied: user=DrWho, access=WRITE, inode="hive-asadm":asadm:asadm:rwxr-xr-x

... for hive shell bash

FAILED: Parse Error: line 1:21 mismatched input 'from' expecting EOF ()
item.summary: Hive jdbc client - throws exception when query was too long

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: it just happens when i used too many OR clauses.

We're not maintaining the 0.4.0 branch. Please upgrade to 0.6.0.
Resolving as wontfix.

item.title: [HIVE-1053] Hive jdbc client - cant use IN inside of WHERE clause
item.description:
I have to use query

select columns from table where columnS='AAA' or columnS='BBB' or columnS='CCC' or ... etc

instead of 

select columns from table where columnS in ('AAA', 'BBB', 'CCC')
item.summary: Hive jdbc client - cant use IN inside of WHERE clause

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-1054] "CHANGE COLUMN" does not support changing partition column types.
item.summary: "CHANGE COLUMN" does not support changing partition column types.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Right now, it seems hive meta data does not support alter partition keys. I am getting "Invalid alter operation: partition keys can not be changed."
Talked with Prasad today, this should not be supported.
Yongqiang, could you comment on why this should not be supported?

I think problem there is what will happen to existing partitions? One has to come up for the convention of how does adding / dropping of column maps to dir structure on hdfs and then possibly need to move around/rename partition dirs to match with this convention.

@Ashutosh

What if we only allow changing the type of a partition column?

I agree adding/dropping/renaming partition columns has a host of difficulties to manage, but I thought changing a partition column's type shouldn't involve a change in hdfs, simply a metadata change.

One problem there could be that all partition values are stored as string, so type info is completely lost in mysql. As a result partition filters cannot be pushed in mysql for any types other then string. This is also documented in listPartitionsByFilter() api of metastoreclient. Though, I don't find that this is enforced anywhere (that might itself be a bug). As a result, changing a type of partition column from string to int or vice-versa might result in change in behavior.

item.title: [HIVE-1055] changing datatype of a partitioning column should be allowed
item.summary: changing datatype of a partitioning column should be allowed

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
Talked with Prasad today, this should not be supported.
Users can change metadata database manually if want to change partition columns information.

item.title: [HIVE-1056] Predicate push down does not work with UDTF's
item.description:
Predicate push down does not work with UDTF's in lateral views

hive> SELECT * FROM src LATERAL VIEW explode(array(1,2,3)) myTable AS k WHERE k=1;
FAILED: Unknown exception: null
hive>
item.summary: Predicate push down does not work with UDTF's

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
• Enables UDTF's to emit rows on close. Although this was disabled initially, it should be allowed. Without this, the test with lateral views on partitioned tables will fail.
  • Enables PPD for LV. To make pruning easier, a new operator (LateralViewForward) is placed at the head of every LV DAG. Otherwise, it is difficult for the pruner to handle the special case for LV's.
Will take a look.

item.title: [HIVE-1057] Add column pruning to handle UDTF's
item.description: Unused column should be pruned when using UDTF's with the lateral view syntax.
item.summary: Add column pruning to handle UDTF's

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-1058] Mapjoin operator need to clean up rowcainters used in HashMapWrapper
item.description: Right now rowcainter use tmp file as backup storage. So the user need to invoke clear() of RowContainer to delete tmp files.
item.summary: Mapjoin operator need to clean up rowcainters used in HashMapWrapper

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-1059] Date/DateTime/TimeStamp types should throw an error
item.description: Currently hive doesn't support date, datetime, or timestamp types. Using these in a create table / alter table should throw a descriptive error that suggests users to use a string type.
item.summary: Date/DateTime/TimeStamp types should throw an error

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: +1. Will test and commit.

Committed to both trunk and branch-0.5.
Thanks Paul!
sorry for late comment, but i don't think this works if some one created a table with timestamp datatype using metastore thrift api. or does it?

Sorry for late comment as well. Is there any effort going on to add these types. The language manual http://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/Hive/LanguageManual/DDL defines these as acceptable types. So should we update the manual?
To address Prasad's comment, I've created HIVE-1111. I haven't heard of efforts to add these types - seems that strings have been working well. I've updated the manual to reflect this.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: HIVE-1059. Date/DateTime/TimeStamp types should throw an error. (Paul Yang via zshao)

item.title: [HIVE-1060] disable SELECT * FROM a JOIN b ON key
item.description:
In some SQL dialect, we support this kind of syntax as a shortcut of "a.key = b.key".

We should output an error for this. Currently we are allowing this because we might have implicit type conversion from String to Boolean.
item.summary: disable SELECT * FROM a JOIN b ON key

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Checks for join condition being just a single un-prefixed column of either primitive or complex type

One more question:

Can you find out why the follow-on semantic analysis didn't catch this problem?
The column reference should end up with "ambiguous column" since both tables have this column, but apparently it didn't.
BTW, there is a standard SQL:200n construct SELECT * FROM a JOIN b USING(key), so we might want to file a followup JIRA for providing the original behavior using the standard (unambiguous) syntax.

Can you add a test in negative tests ?

Also, do you think it would be simpler to check for "=" instead of the check you have added.
Added a negative test. The conditional can also be a function, so a simple '=' test won't be sufficient.

item.title: [HIVE-1061] test error in input_dfs.q when doing "ant -Dbuild.dir.hive=/tmp/abcdef test"
item.description:
Stack trace here:

    [junit] Begin query: input_dfs.q
    [junit] cat: File ../build/ql/test/data/files/kv1.txt does not exist.
    [junit] junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Client Execution failed with error code = -1
    [junit] Exception: Client Execution failed with error code = -1
    [junit] 	at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:47)
    [junit] 	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli.TestCliDriver.testCliDriver_input_dfs(TestCliDriver.java:5814)

    [junit] 	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)

    [junit] 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
    [junit] 	at junit.framework.TestCase.runTest(TestCase.java:154)
    [junit] 	at junit.framework.TestCase.runBare(TestCase.java:127)
    [junit] 	at junit.framework.TestResult$1.protect(TestResult.java:106)
    [junit] 	at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected(TestResult.java:124)
    [junit] 	at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:109)
    [junit] 	at junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:118)
    [junit] 	at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:208)
    [junit] 	at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:203)

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-1063] Variable interpolation for testcase qfiles
item.description:
I would like to be able to reference system property variables in qfile testcases, e.g.:

add jar ${hive.contrib.jar.path};

instead of

add jar ../build/contrib/hive_contrib.jar;

This should make it possible to cope with JAR names that reference the version number.
item.summary: Variable interpolation for testcase qfiles

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
• Implement system property variable interpolation for qfiles
  • Update contrib qfiles to reference variable instead of literal path for hive_contrib.jar
  • Changed the name of hive_contrib.jar to hive-contrib-0.6.0.jar in line with HIVE-978.
Carl, there are 3 conflicts when applying to trunk. Could you resolve it first? Thanks,
@Ning: I discovered a bug while updating the patch. Will need a little time to fix this. I'll post the updated patch when I am done.
Fixed in HIVE-1096.

hive>
item.summary: NPE when operating HiveCLI in distributed mode

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
• Fixes NPE by updating signature of ExecDriver.initialize().
  • Add @Override annotation initialize() methods.
  • Remove unnecessary initialize() methods.

Carl, there are a lot of conflicts when applying this patch to the latest trunk. It may be because of the two large patches committed recently. There should not be further large patches in recently, can you resolve the conflicts and resubmit a new patch? I'll start reviewing right away from there.
Also can you add a unit test?

• Updated the patch against trunk.
  • Will open another JIRA to track adding a distributed mode testcase.

+1. The code changes looks good. Will commit once the tests pass.

One questions though: what are the situation you see this NPE? I cannot reproduce it from trunk.

@Ning: I'm running Hive on top of an 0.18.3 pseudo-distributed mode cluster.
Any query requiring an MR phase produces an NPE in ExecDriver.execute()
because the ExecDriver.initialize() method is not getting called.

Thanks Carl.

The parallel test failed on hadoop 0.17.2.1. I'll rerun tests in sequential.
Carl, please remember to open a JIRA for adding a unit test if possible. That's the best way to prevent this happening in the future.
@Ning: See HIVE-1080

item.title: [HIVE-1065] When data is large,a reducer's memory can not hold the big data by using list to store the data, and get an error "out of memory"
item.description: When data is large,I do a "join" operation ,a reducer's memory can not hold the big data by using list to store the data, and get an error "out of memory"
item.summary: When data is large,a reducer's memory can not hold the big data by using list to store the data, and get an error "out of memory"

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Please swap the order of the table in the join clause. If it's "... from a join b ...", we can do "... from b join a ...".

MapJoin,bucket mapJoin,sorted bucket MapJoin.
and also can used Stream table to steam the big table.
if two table's data is also very large .
try skew join. change the tasknum.
